annonstext:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.

Connectivity at Scania is one of the key components in Scania’s “driving the shift” strategy. At the department Connected Systems (EC), 100+ R&D wizards work with enabling solutions all the way from the vehicle mounted telematics unit, via Telecom networks to the Scania service platform in the cloud.

Connectivity in general is all about Data. Data in large volumes in a flexible and usable way is a key success factor for organisations that want to survive the digital shift. Scania today have over 450 000 (and counting) vehicles and other products connected online. We are now starting up the development of next generation telematics unit and need to extend the platform team with one more developer.

What you will do

You will be working within a team called “Onboard Platform” that develop and maintain the platform software for our connectivity units. The team is in the middle of a major shift where we are changing focus from our present platform toward the development of next generation telematics. It is a great opportunity to join and be an instrumental part in designing the future for Scania!

Your main tasks will be to set up and develop the framework for automated testing within the team. You will also be part in creating and constantly improving the test strategy and its vision. As well as be the teams expert when it comes to quality assurance and development of the CI/CD pipeline for the platform. To be efficient in you daily work we foresee that you will contribute to the platform development, maintenance and trouble shooting.

Who you are 

You are a software engineer with good programming skills and think quality in a product needs continues attention, a quality assurance mindset. You have experience from C++ development in embedded systems running a Linux/QNX OS (e.g. Raspberry Pi). Experience from adaptive AUTOSAR would be a great benefit.

Other meritous experiences:

• cmake
• Git, gitlab-ci,
• Docker, Jenkins, CI/CD
• Tools for static code analysis.

You are well-structured, cooperative and keen on delivering high quality software. Agile development like Safe and Scrum and continuous deployment are to you well known and appreciated techniques.  

You most likely have a formal engineering degree in software, electrical or computer science, or the equivalent experience. Knowledge in the areas of IoT / connectivity and/or the electrical system of (heavy) vehicles is a great advantage for this role.  

What we can offer you

As a Scania employee, you are offered several benefits in addition to personal and professional development opportunities. These benefits include mutual bonus, company car, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje, Scania Job Express.

Contact information

Do not hesitate to contact FIRSTNAME LASTNAME (Manager),  TELEPHONENO 0.

Application 

Your application should contain a personal letter, CV and relevant certificates/grades. Screening and interviews will be done continuously.

We are looking forward to read your application!
